content.description: SDS with slots under the mini roof. Using the unique fin feature, some fancy footwork, and a little burl will get you over the bulge to the mellow top out.
content.location: The small cave on the lower outcrop of Man in the Chair

content.description: SDS with underclings in the roof. Surmount the bulge and layback the in-cut crack. Top out.
content.location: Crack on the left side of the roof in the lower outcrop.

content.description: Stand start matched on the undercling flake, climb nice ledges to the top. Neat holds.
content.protection: A small pad if you can squeeze it.
content.location: Lower outcrop. The flakes left of Ladyfingers

content.description: Stand start with two crimps at chest height. Climb directly up the slab right of the dihedral. Techy and thin.
content.location: Right of Dude on the Futon

content.description: Stand start with two right-facing crimps at head height. After making a powerful move to a sloper, trend right along a huge fin to a delicate mantle top out.
content.location: First route left of the slabby section on the upper outcrop

content.description: Stand start with a low side-pull edge and a shallow mono-pocket at head height. A nice sequence with sweet grips leads up the face to a mellow top out.
content.location: On the lower outcrop, left of the ladylike arête.

content.description:
Stand start with right hand on an in-cut crimp on the arête and left on an edge. Climb the arête and top out. Techy. Detached blocks are off!

 A sit start may be possible, but would be difficult and awkward trying to avoid the detached blocks.
content.location: On the lower outcrop, left of Widow's Crack

content.description: The sit-down-start to Man in the Chair. SDS with left hand low on a positive edge and right on a higher sloping edge near the mini arête. Pull off the ground and work through more sloping edges to gain the start holds of Man in the Chair.
content.location: Left of the slab on the upper outcrop.

content.description: SDS gastoning a high left hand edge and pulling on a right hand side-pull. Gain the prominent ledge before forging up through the dihedral. There's a bit of chimney action at the top, so wear some tough pants for this one.
content.location: Upper outcrop, right of Man in the Chair

content.description: Stand start matched on an edge at chest height. Climb up through sweet pockets and top out.

Two south facing walls 15+ feet in height. The rock here is prone to making shallow dishes and pockets which provides for some very unique lines.There are several other rock faces that could hold a handful of climbs each, but haven't seen development. They lie on the east end of the ridge that Man in the Chair sits atop.
